title: Canada’s Ability to Prevent Forest Fires Lags Behind the Need
description: Provincial firefighting agencies are stretched thin, there is no national agency and it’s hard to get approval for controlled burns — factors that have exacerbated recent outbreaks.

title: Battles Rage as Ukraine Tries to Retake Russian-Occupied Territory
description: Military analysts and U.S. officials said it was too soon to judge the success of Ukraine’s offensive, which is looking for weaknesses to exploit, in the face of fierce resistance.

title: How to Help Thousands of Canadians Displaced by Wildfires
description: Federal and provincial governments have pledged to match donations to the Canadian Red Cross for those affected by wildfires in Nova Scotia, Alberta and the Northwest Territories.

title: Boris Johnson Resigns From Parliament
description: The former prime minister quit after getting a confidential report about whether he had lied to lawmakers about lockdown-breaking parties.

title: Pope Francis and Silvio Berlusconi Both Hospitalized in Italy
description: The health conditions of two of Italy’s most prominent octogenarians have in recent years often kept the country in suspense.

title: A Surprising Supreme Court Decision’s History With the American South
description: To understand the significance of this week’s U.S. Supreme Court ruling, books about the Deep South’s changes in the 20th century are critical to read.

title: Will Wildfires Like Canada’s Become the New Normal?
description: Canada’s devastating fires and toxic smoke might not recur every year, but the heat from climate change increases the risks of a wide range of disasters.

title: Air Slowly Clears in Eastern U.S., but Canada Remains Engulfed in Flames
description: Hundreds of wildfires are burning across Canada, displacing tens of thousands of people. In the eastern United States, the air quality continued to improve.

title: President Vucic Plays Up His Role as Defender of Serbs
description: President Aleksandar Vucic, who has been the target of protests in Belgrade, has been playing up his role defending Serbs in Kosovo, where tensions have recently flared.

title: U.S. Releases Details on Iran’s Help With Russian Drone Factory
description: Washington is trying to raise the pressure on Tehran and make it more difficult to complete the work on the factory, which would enable Russia’s military to produce drones domestically.

title: Macron Meets Victims and ‘Backpack Hero’ After Stabbing Attack in France
description: Two adults and four children were injured in the assault, which shocked the country and could have been worse if not for the intervention of a 24-year-old man known only as Henri.

title: U.S. Spy Satellites Detected Explosion Before Ukraine Dam Collapse, Official Says
description: U.S. spy agencies still do not have any solid evidence to determine who caused the destruction, the senior administration official said.

title: Four Australian Shows and Movies for Your Watchlist
description: Love stories, survival reality and stop motion animation: What we’re enjoying.

title: An Everest Climber Had ‘No Energy, No Oxygen, Nothing.’ A Sherpa Saved Him.
description: The arduous six-hour rescue in May came during an especially deadly spring climbing season on the world’s highest mountain.

title: 2 Killed in Russian Shelling in Flood Zone, Officials Say
description: Russian attacks are complicating evacuation and aid efforts in areas devastated by the destruction of the Kakhovka dam.

title: Sweden to Allow NATO Troop on Its Soil
description: NATO is more optimistic that Turkey will approve Sweden’s membership before or soon after an alliance summit next month.

title: Another Indictment
description: Donald Trump’s handling of classified documents was genuinely unusual.

title: Dam’s Destruction Reshapes Ukraine, but Not Arc of the War
description: The main thrust of the Ukrainian counteroffensive is expected in the Zaporizhzhia and Donetsk regions, not along the Dnipro River, where the fighting quickly resumed after the disaster.

title: Manipur, India’s Blood-Soaked War Zone
description: An outburst of ethnic hatreds has fractured an ancient kingdom and turned neighbors into enemies.

title: Can He Fix ‘Palace of Scaffolding’ in Time for Belgium’s 200th Birthday?
description: For an architect trying to renovate his beloved but crumbling Palace of Justice in Brussels, once the largest building in the world, the design challenges pale compared with the political ones.

title: In Thailand, Defamation Lawsuits Can Make Free Speech Costly
description: In Thailand, companies and people in positions of power often use libel suits to intimidate and punish activists and critics.

title: Your Friday Briefing
description: Federal charges against Donald Trump.

title: China to Build Station That Could Spy on U.S. from Cuba, Officials Say
description: The planned facility could amplify Beijing’s technological capacity to monitor military operations across the Southeastern states.
